attributes.action: Limit Principal Private Residence Relief so the Rich pay Tax on their home sale.
attributes.background: Principal Private Residence Relief means noone has to pay Tax on the profit they make when they sell their home.  This also means the Rich can make £millions when they sell their home and not pay tax at all, at the same time that the Housing Crisis is the biggest social issue our country faces.

attributes.action: Make the glamorous promotion and unavoidable shop displays of alcohol illegal.
attributes.background: Alcohol is promoted on tv in every ad break, its at the entrance of every supermarket and at the end of every aisle! In the summer the ads and supermarkets tell you its not summer without a beer, you can't enjoy a bbq or dinner party without wine, that wine makes you better company around friends!!
attributes.additional_details: Im not saying ban it! But lets stick it in a separate section in the supermarket that is out of sight and not the first thing you see as you walk in!! Don't glamourise it in front of our kids but don't make it a forbidden fruit either!! Keep it out of the local all night stores and remove the ads that glamourise it from our tv, magazines and billboards! Lets have some balance, some honesty, some education please!! We all know where the alcohol is and if we want it, we know where we can buy it!!

attributes.action: Change the Examination System for Mathematics in the UK
attributes.background: My daughter had five attempts at passing her GCSE Mathematics and I see from TV reports that many children are struggling to pass leaving us with a generation of children who may never pass due to the rigours of the examination containing techniques that none of us ever use again.
attributes.additional_details: Why don't we have one exam containing addition, multiplication, subtraction and division for the less able students allowing them to at least leave school with a qualification and a more in depth exam for those wishing to study mathematics or wish careers where complicated maths is needed. Even my sons maths tutor could not finish the higher GCSE exam and he has a degree in maths. Why doesn't the government take notice of what is happening -  The Exam system is broken.

attributes.action: Premier League Football to be transmitted 'free to air' in England and Wales
attributes.background: Since the dawn of the 'Premier League Era', the industry now generates revenues in excess of £3.3bn. One could argue, with such a highly profitable industry, the 'Governing Bodies' and 'Broadcasters' could facilitate free to air games in their respective domestic leagues without suffering huge loss.

attributes.action: Make law and politics a core study in high school; like maths, English & science
attributes.background:
As the popular proverb suggests "knowledge is power."Thus, it seems to me our electorate is powerless! 

We complain about the turnout for elections and that people don't really understand the political and legal systems (especially 18 to 24s). So let's do something about it
attributes.additional_details:
Quite often in elections less than 50% of young people between the ages of 18 & 24 actually vote. Furthermore, it is often less than 70% of eligible voters who actually vote. 

In the general election 2015, 43% of 18 to 24s voted and only 66% of all eligible voters cast a vote. This is not good enough.

attributes.background: Remove license with £200 fine for all drivers caught on phone

attributes.background: Care leavers are seven times more likely to die before they hit 21!! And those who don't are highly likely to go onto offending, substance misuse, violent relationships and poor mental health etc due to the lack of support. Stop setting these young people up to fail!

attributes.action: Provide funding to food banks to help supply appropriate food to ethnic groups
attributes.background: There is currently a regional situation whereby food bank charities would not supply appropriate food to multiple different ethnic groups’ requirements, such as Halal. This needs the government's backing as the health of this country's community, can not be left as the responsibility of charities.

attributes.action: Do a 3 month trial of letting people choose what their tax gets paid on.
attributes.background: Letting people choose what their tax gets paid on each month may help us feel more positive about the amount of tax we pay.

attributes.action: Lower insurance premiums for 17- 25 year olds.<£1500
attributes.background: Earning minimum wage and cannot afford such a high insurance premium on such a low wage. Something needs to be done.

attributes.action: Ban all Americans from the UK until Donald Trump's Muslim Ban is revoked.
attributes.background:
Donald Trump has imposed a disgusting ban on people from majority Muslim nations under the guise of a national security issue despite the fact that no terrorist attack on American soil has originated in those countries. 

We ask that all Americans be banned until Trump realises his error.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to implore the government to make a strong statement that Britain is against islamophobic policies and communicate this to Steve Bannon & Donald Trump in a language that they cannot ignore.

attributes.action: Make schools teach the dangers of using drugs and alcohol
attributes.background: Children become curious from a young age because not enough is being taught about this stuff in schools but like sex education they should be playing Video clips of the reality of what can happen when you take drugs and drink heavily, A once a week lesson in this could change many children's minds.

attributes.action: 21st Century Britain Needs a Written Constitution
attributes.background: Post Brexit Multicultural UK needs a written constitution. Democracy is fragile, the citizens of the country are responsible to safe guard it. A written constitution will empower them to be the watch dogs of democracy. This will ultimately make the majority accommodate and the minority reassured.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop foreign companies taking over British successful companies
attributes.background: Over the last 30 years, many of Britain’s successful and well known companies have been taking over by foreign companies, only to be broken up or their factories moved aboard. This new law would stop this practice if it was considered not be in the national interest.

attributes.action: Ban the delivery of charity collection bags to households in the U.K.
attributes.background: Large plastic charity bags, wrapped in plastic envelopes are delivered to thousands of households in the U.K. every week. Only a tiny percentage are filled for collection with the majority ending-up straight in the homeowners bin and off to landfill. This unnecessary use of plastic bags must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
It is believed that 500,000 plastic charity collection bags are sent to landfill every year. Each bag is delivered inside yet another plastic bag envelope meaning some one million bags are disposed of in our landfill sites around the country every year, via doorstep delivery.
Most local council recycling stations, as well as many towns and villages retain clothing bins and can be freely used to dispose of such unwanted goods easily and without the need for such large scale waste.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-rescue cats and dogs In pet stores.
attributes.background:
San Francisco enacted a new law stating that pet shops can only sell cats and dogs that come from rescue centres.

Let's follow in their footsteps to ensure that rescued animals find a home before dogs and cats are needlessly bred for profit!
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, the RSPCA alone rescued and collected 118,994 animals. In the same year, 5,142 had to be put down because of overcrowding in shelters and lack of resources. 

We, the people of the UK, request a law that will ensure that pet stores will help find homes for the hundreds of thousands of dogs and cats left to be forgotten BEFORE breeding more!

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsround/39004663

http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/609353/The-Dogs-Trust-stray-dog-crisis-in-UK

attributes.action: Students to have over an hour and a half of Physical Education a week
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that students have to have over an hour and a half of physical education per week.

attributes.action: Introduce knowledge on diversity and the LGBT+ to the primary school curriculum
attributes.background: If children are introduced to diversity and the lgbt+ community from a young age this could prevent racism and homophobia. Hate is taught not inate.
attributes.additional_details: Every single person i have encountered who support discrimination were either taught to do so or were only introduced to it via insults (e.g "that's so gay") however those of us who do not, tend to have been shown that skin colour or sexual orientation does not define a person. teaching young children about these topics and people can help them understand that everyone is different and nobody should never be ashamed of who they are.

attributes.action: Charge cyclists road tax and insurance,require to have side mirrors by law
attributes.background: Cyclists causes accidents ,damages and hold us drivers up . They should pay insurance in case they damage cars or are involved in rtc.they use our roads so they should pay some  road tax! Accidents could be prevented if riders were required to use Mirrors so they don't just pull out in front of us!
attributes.additional_details: They cause traffic ques. They have hold us up and we pay to use the road ...

attributes.action: Conduct a full review into Business Rates to make them fairer to small business.
attributes.background: The upcoming revaluation of business rates will result in crippling increases to some small businesses already struggling to compete with online retailers. We call upon the government to postpone the revaluation until a full review has been carried out and the sytem made fairer to small business.

attributes.action: Remove or greatly increase the petition character limit, currently capped at 880
attributes.background: The current character limit in petition descriptions is too small to include a highly meaningful body of evidence, argument, and other relevant information. Governmental ability to reply to petitions is notably unencumbered. People should be able to engage in responsive dialogue with the government.
attributes.additional_details: Many members of the public are informed on an extensive variety of subjects, ranging from obscure and niche, to popular and general interest. These people are ideally suited to approach the government via petition, to better educate the public and government alike. However, current character limitations means only small fragments of their expertise can be represented. Given the government's latitude in ability to respond to these petitions, the public should be granted similar levels of freedom.

attributes.action: Increase national insurance contributions by £5 a person a month to save the NHS
attributes.background:
The NHS is in crisis. I'm sure most if not everyone would be happy to pay an extra £5 a month in national insurance contributions to help save our special health care system. 
We cannot lose the NHS, or is that what the conservative government want...

attributes.action: Make schools have nit nurses back and children with lice stay home.
attributes.background: Are you sick and tired of your children getting headlice because parents are forced to send their children to school with headlice, as schools see education been more important than health? I certainly am. Help to get nit nurses back into schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents of children with headlice are been harrassed to send their children to school and the spread of lice continues. 
They think if a childs hair is tied up they can not be spread. Wrong.
They think as long as your actively trying to get rid of them, the child should be in school. Wrong.
Children with headlice should be kept off school until the headlice are completely gone and the nit nurse should be able to check before allowing a child back into school. 
A once a week visit would sufice.

attributes.action: Incentivise the switch from diesel to electric & low emission petrol vehicles.
attributes.background: Diesel vehicles cause thousands of deaths per year and unnecessarily put huge pressure on the health service. An incentivised scrap & switch scheme for diesel vehicles is the only way the government can ensure pollution is reduced and diesel cars are taken off the road.
attributes.additional_details:
"UK air pollution 'linked to 40,000 early deaths a year'" - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35629034

"Diesel cars should be phased out to stop pollution deaths, says Chief Medical Officer " - http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/12/30/diesel-cars-should-phased-stop-pollution-deaths-says-chief-medical/

"Five facts about diesel the car industry would rather not tell you" - https://www.transportenvironment.org/sites/te/files/publications/2015_09_Five_facts_about_diesel_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Make Ofsted Inspections in Schools a regular, unexpected thing without knowing
attributes.background: Teachers change how they teach and behave when ofsted are at the school. I think that ofsted should be unexpected and should be a last minute thing for teachers to know.

attributes.action: The establishment of UK legislation protecting Net Neutrality
attributes.background: The free and open internet as it is today has fostered innovation, provided access to information, and facilitated many cultural, economic and political opportunities across this world. It is a driver and tool of innovation, globally and here in the UK. And should be protected so it is not lost.
attributes.additional_details: With the Great Repeal Bill coming forward, we have concerns over the potential loss of protection to Net Neutrality. While the Broadcasters Stakeholders Group has a Code of Practise, this is a voluntary measure and if the UK was to open up contracts to global companies for future trade deals, this measure may not be enough to safeguard Net Neutrality here in Britain. We want the government to take early action and also establish the UK as a global leader in safeguarding a free and open internet.

attributes.action: Leaving Care age to be raised to the August after 18th birthday if in education
attributes.background: Care leavers aged 18 in full time education should be classed as 'eligible' or 'relevant' until the 31st August after their 18th Birthday, to be entitled to accommodation and maintenance. This ceases at 18, when they become 'former relevant'. It is unfair to have to study whilst setting up a home.
attributes.additional_details:
The percentage of care leavers in further and higher education is statistically lower than their peers. Being able to manage and complete their education may prove to be a struggle when leaving care.
In terms of child benefit entitlement, a ‘qualifying young person’ can be aged 18 and 19 in full-time education. This extends financial support to young people post-18. Care leavers should have their support extended to the same age as they are some of the most vulnerable people in society.

attributes.action: Parental responsibility should be transferred to the parent who has residency.
attributes.background: Currently the law indicates that Parental Responsibility is those who have legal rights and responsibilities for the child's upbringing, who can make decisions regarding schooling, name changes etc. I want the government to debate if the law should be amended in the cases where a parent wants no
attributes.additional_details: further contact with a child and cases of harm to the child, for the responsibility and decision making to be transferred over to the remaining parent. My sons father is unable to see his son due to the CAFCASS report and he also informed court he wants no further contact. I have changed my sons surname by Deedpoll but passport etc needs authorisation and permission from the father, even in these circumstances when all evidence shown. These rights should be abolished.

attributes.action: Introduce a new 'National Health Tax' which is only to be used for NHS.
attributes.background: Most people in the UK seem to be happy with paying extra to fund the NHS. An new NHT would target funds directly to where they are needed and not form part of a central pot. NHT could be applied to the following: Petrol and diesel, Alcohol, tobacco, UK visitors at port of entry (£25.00) etc
attributes.additional_details:
NHT would be in addition to VAT but NOT be applied to direct income.
For example current VAT at 20% could be raised to 21% to include 1% NHT. The government could no longer be blamed for not having enough cash as the NHT would be a disclosed figure and allocated directly. We should also reduce grants to the FA and other organisations not in need and reduce overseas aid. This saving can be converted as an NHT income.

attributes.action: NHS to revert back to using bank nurses and stop using agency nurses.
attributes.background: I am informed by my local MP Rt Hon David Evennett MP that the NHS saved £600 million in the first year of reducing using agency staff.  Obviously to stop this use would be a worthwhile saving particular as the NHS needs the money urgently now.

attributes.action: Amend the Aggravated Murder of and  Violence against Women Bill to include men
attributes.background: The Bill had its first reading in Parliament on the 31st January 2017. The obvious thing that was picked up by one member of parliament, that being Philip Davies, was that he recognised that the bill was sexist. How it got approved is beyond comprehension.

attributes.action: Put legalizing medical cannabis to a referendum/ballot
attributes.background: If the prime minister is willing to quit the common market because of the will of the people then should medical cannabis for the sick be put to a Referendum/ballot to determine the will of the people? And act on it now!

attributes.action: TAX non-reusable sanitary products & give out free reusable pads, cups & nappies
attributes.background:
'Disposable' items such as tampon applicators and wipes pollute our beaches, end up in landfill, and Kill wildlife.
With the revenue generated from the TAX, give out free reusable pads, cups and nappies.
If there is any money leftover this should go towards cleaning the UK coasts of rubbish.
attributes.additional_details:
www.facebook.com/keeptampontax/

https://www.theguardian.com/vital-signs/2015/feb/12/science-plastic-oceans-study-fish-pollution-worse

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/21/flushing-tampons-toilet-blocks-drains-sanitary-products

attributes.action: Student maintenance loans to include parental outgoings as well as incomings
attributes.background: When a student applies for a maintenance loan through Student Finance UK, they have to declare their total annual household income. Whilst this may be effective for the upper and lower class, many of the middle class families lose out substantially.
attributes.additional_details: With a maximum loan of 8,200 for students with an annual household income of less than £25,000, no financial aid is expected of their parents or guardians. However, despite a student turning 18, being a separate legal entity to their parents or guardians, parents are expected to help despite their outgoings. Annual household incomes over £62,177 allow students to be entitled to a £3,821 loan. With accomodation nearly always over this amount, parents are expected to help to the extent of £5,000.

attributes.action: Start a Hate Offender's Register,  modelled on the Sex Offender's Register.
attributes.background: Parents should have the right to know if their child runs the risk of being bullied or radicalised by hate preachers in their neighbourhood. A register of hate offenders will empower subjects of Her Majesty to make informed choices on who they may wish to avoid to keep safe and avoid conflict.

attributes.action: Make labelling GMO foods mandatory.
attributes.background: It is still unsure as to the health effects of Genetically Modified Organism's and there is evidence to support the unsustainablility of GMO's in future agriculture.

Seems selling to anyone with out a licence or the person having no conscious of there actions for a quick turn around of money these cars having no mot with many defects tax or insurance

attributes.action: Make people register for gig tickets before the sale to stop hackers and touts
attributes.background: Its unfair that true fans are missing out on getting tickets to see their favourite artists due to hackers,computer programmes and touts buying tickets in high volumes and re-selling seconds after the tours selling out for extortionate amounts, lets make a registration like glastonbury stand for all

attributes.action: Stop GM wheat planting in the UK!
attributes.background: The Government has given permission for GM wheat crops to be tested again in the UK.  The last time they tried this, it did not work and cost the public £3m.  Birds will pick ears and drop them in non-GM fields, which will make normal wheat infertile and will seriously affect organic farms.
attributes.additional_details: The Soil Association, GM Freeze (an association of over 30 organisations) and most UK farmers are totally against GM crops. There is no way to confine this to the planting area, as has been proved in the US and most US farmers have stopped planting this as consumers didn't want it.

attributes.action: all state visits to be approved by parliament before an invite is given.
attributes.background: to avoid the situation the country is in regarding the trump state visit

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background:
I find it unlawful for the government to think that there is a correlation between University funding and a household income.

A huge majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this petition is to make the system that is already in place fairer for everyone.

People that want to go to university but won't receive help from these 'dependant people' (from the household income system in place) should not be left short and left to struggle.

attributes.action: Make all drinks producers  replace plastic containers with glass bottles.
attributes.background: Many years ago,all drinks were sold in glass bottles with very little effect on the environment,unlike the plastic containers which are causing serious pollution,especially in seas and oceans.
attributes.additional_details: A deposit scheme could be introduced to ensure most bottles were returned for re-cycling.

attributes.action: Build a link road connecting the M54 to the M6 Toll bypassing Featherstone
attributes.background: The advantages of using the M6 Toll can be negated by delays caused by congestion in Featherstone
attributes.additional_details: The road through Featherstone must produce very excessive pollution to those living along it and it must be dreadful driving in and out of those premises

attributes.action: Make contents insurance mandatory for all council tenants
attributes.background:
We live in a semi detached house which we own.  This is an ex council house. The house that we are attached to is still owned by the Council.

As we have a morgage we have to take out building and contents insurance. 

But if you are a council Tennant you don't have to have insurance of any kind
attributes.additional_details:
The house next door had a very sevier fire and we have been out of our house for a long time

Our insurance covered us for our damage but as there is not any insurance with the next door property our insurance premium will go up

I was not aware that insurance is optional if you are a council tenant and even though none of this is our fault we are the ones left paying the price

Thing's  need to change and I don't think it's too much to ask a council tenant to take responsibility for themselves

attributes.action: Lower university fees down to £3,000 as they were before 2012.
attributes.background: People want to access further education but don't have the necessary funds to support themselves. By lowering the fees students will not leave university with crippling debts.

attributes.action: Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies.
attributes.background:
Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies and Bailffs.
If anyone in the UK has or is experiencing any kind of financial difficulties then passing the debt to any Debt collection agency or Bailffs incur extra cost to which adds extra stress and anxiety.

attributes.action: International students in U.K should have a standard form of maintenance loan
attributes.background: As an international student I've personally been able to experience firsthand economic struggles at university. International students undoubtedly face economic strain with fees & limitations on their economic welfare the government should be able to place a standardised maintenance loan for us.
attributes.additional_details: Increase in international student fees from last year alone at Universities across the country.

attributes.action:
1.Importance of voters age of 50 years and above.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.
attributes.background: I used to study in UK  .As a foreigner it felt so good that something which British citizens (locals) were voting and i as a foreigner was also voting.That showed me the importance,responsibility and equity in that very moment about voting.
attributes.additional_details:
1.Considering double the votes for elections only for those voters above the age of 50 years.As elders know the best to choose and by doing so it will encourage the young generation to vote and also to choose wisely and the best for the nation.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.There should be proper knowledge provided to the students in schools & colleges about what the votes are and what are the benefits to vote for themselves and for the nation.

attributes.action: Pass: Representation of the People Act - Additional Member System (AMS / MMP)
attributes.background: Our voting system forces the major parties to devote to only swing seats. It doesn't treat voters equally. In parts of the country the opposition parties put up nothing more than a token effort in elections. Regions are dominated by one party despite opponents recording substantial numbers of votes.
attributes.additional_details:
"First past the post has been a huge contributing factor in how remote people feel from politics. As vote share for the major two parties has declined, it is a fact that our general elections have become less and less representative ... It should be a source of national concern that there have been three general elections in history in which the party with the most votes has actually lost the general election."

Source: - http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/blog/jonathan-reynolds-speech

attributes.action: guarantee all EU football players be exempt from net migration targets
attributes.background: Parliament needs to guarantee that in the forthcoming Brexit negotiations there will be provision made for the free movement of all EU football players to work in UK Football Clubs. A lot of football supporters need reassurance that this group of workers will be exempted from immigration targets.
